text: Approved paving drawings and pavement design (thickness, lifts, materials) reviewed
Asphalt mix design (job-mix formula, JMF) approved by consultant or city
Weather conditions checked: ambient >5°C, surface dry, and no rain forecasted
Subgrade compacted and tested for density and moisture content
Granular base (GBC or equivalent) placed in lifts and compacted to 100% standard Proctor
Proof rolling completed and approved by consultant prior to asphalt placement
Paver preheated and screed adjusted for thickness and slope
Tack coat applied evenly to cold joint or milled surface
Asphalt temperature upon delivery recorded (typically >120°C for hot-mix)
Paving completed in accordance with lift thickness (e.g., 50 mm base, 40 mm surface)
Steel drum and pneumatic rollers used within temperature window
Joint compaction and overlaps inspected (cold joints reheated if needed)
Core or nuclear density tests taken and meet compaction spec (typically >92% of max density)
Final grade and cross slope confirmed with straight edge and/or level
Surface finish smooth, with no tearing, segregation, or roller marks
Traffic allowed only after full cooling or as specified in project documents
